html:
Humble Bundle is partnering with Crisis Text Line for World Mental Health Day on October 10 – an organization that provides free, confidential, mental health support through text, 24/7.

A portion of all Humble Choice Subscription sign ups throughout the month of October will be donated to Crisis Text Line and will support their efforts in two main areas.

One of those areas focuses on Humble launching a new program with Crisis Text Line that supports mental health in the gaming community by creating a safe space for gamers. A portion of the funds raised from the Humble Choice Subscriptions throughout October will go toward combating, "loneliness and mental health concerns within the gaming community." You can also find a Crisis Text Line x Humble Bundle guide to supporting gamers who deal with loneliness.

Crisis Text Line is also providing a dedicated line for the Humble community and all gamers, which can be reached by texting "HUMBLE" to 741741 for free, confidential, mental health support 24/7. Currently all US text support is available in both English and Spanish.

Crisis Text Line is also expanding their global reach, specifically in the Latin America region, by raising funds to train volunteer Crisis Counselor's for this population so they can support those in need.

The Humble Choice subscription starts at $11.99 per month and you'll receive curated games each month, as well as 20% off in the Humble store, and are able to skip a month or cancel anytime. Some of the games for the October subscription include Remnant II, Persona 5 Strikers, Jusant, Station to Station, and others.

Mental Health Resources can be found below:

  • Gamers Guide to Battle Loneliness
  • Crisis Text Line website
  • Humble Bundle x Crisis Text Line Helping Gamers
  • How to Overcome Loneliness
  • Mental Health Awareness Month stats and support
  • Ways to Donate
